text:
Sixth Avenue (left), east side, and Sullivan Street (right), east side, north from Broome Street. The two houses at the N.E. corner of Sullivan and Broome Streets have been demolished, leaving exposed the frame side of 59 Sullivan Street adjoining the vacant corner.
March 19, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Broome Street

text:
Sixth Ave. (Extension), west side, south from, but not including Broome, to and including Watts Streets, showing (at the extreme right) a portion of the Underwriters Salvage Co. 6-story building, at the S.W. corner of Broome Street. The 3-story house, in the center of the view, is a frame building, and bears the No. 46 Watts Street, and is at the N.W. corner.

June 7, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - w.s. - South - Broome Street

text:
Sixth Avenue, west side, from Broome to Dominick Streets, showing P. S. No. 38. Prior to the extension of 6th Avenue this frontage was a part of Clark Street. This street, only 2 blocks long was completely obliterated. Broome Street is on the left and the view there extends to Varick Street. In the foreground is Sullivan Street separated from the new 6th Avenue by a triangular plot.

June 7, 1933
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Broome - Dominick Street.

text:
Sixth Avenue, west side, from Broome to Dominick Streets, showing P. S. No. 38. Prior to the extension of 6th Avenue this frontage was a part of Clark Street. This street, only 2 blocks long was completely obliterated. Broome Street is on the left and the view there extends to Varick Street. In the foreground is Sullivan Street separated from the new 6th Avenue by a triangular plot.

June 7, 1933
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Broome - Dominick Street.
